reviews.review_msg: She made me fall in love with arch! Be prepared to attend lecture and put in work. I did read the textbooks and found them to be helpful but focus on the lecture material more for the exams. She is passionate about her work and is a brilliant instructor. I always visited her in office hours and got a B+  in the class.
She is super passionate  and knowledgeable about the course.  She is also very clear with what is going to be on the exam. Great prof!

Not a big fan of her teaching and tests. There are only 3 tests the whole term and the first two are practically the same yet one is worth 50% and the other only 30%.We also received a take home essay but it is useless because we are being asked to basically repeat exactly what she said.

I actually like D'Andrea - she is helpful and approachable, and seems to care about the students. My biggest issue with this course is the exams. Requires memorization of hundreds of terms/people/ideas and if you have forgotten a small handful it is possible to fail, as the scope of the exams is rather limited.

Her tests are ridiculous. Matching, definitions, and essay questions. You are required to learn and memorize over 150 terms at least for each test, yet she only tests you on 5 or 6. No list of specific terms to study, anything is game. Asks questions on terms she spends very little time on. At least give us a list of terms to study.
Extremely helpful and engaging. Clear, concise lectures.

Really good class... Pretty easy if you go to the lectures/ listen to them online. GREAT powerpoint slides! Was very clear about what was going to be on exams. If you have any interest in ancient Egypt or Africa definitely take this class.

Cathy was a great professor - her lectures were definitely long, but were made interesting with the incorporation of pictures and some videos. If you're interested in the archaeology of ancient Egypt, this is the class to get some more background knowledge. The three tests were pretty easy, except for the essays, which I felt she marked too hard.

Heavy on the readings, 60-90 slides per 3hr lecture, hard marker & some tests are unusually difficult (inconsistent with emphasized points in lecture). Seriously impossible to ace the tests unless you memorize *everything* including random details. Even if your interest level is high, AVOID THIS CLASS like you would the bubonic plague.
Very boring lectures, three hours of blah! Exams are unfair, barely any choice and quite a few obscure terms.Marks hard also. Loved the topic but she ruined it. Would avoid her in the future.

LOVED this class--amazing prof, extremely helpful if you go to her office hours, kept the 3hr lectures interesting.  The exams (were only 3 exams for entire grade) are difficult, but not if you study and know the lecture material WELL.  Definitely recommend the course!
Cathy is fairly interesting to listen to. The lectures are three hours long so sometimes boredom sets in, but for the most part she keeps my attention. The midterms are difficult but fair.
Cutie patootie

Great course. Sort of felt unprepared for essay questions, due to large amounts of material. but other than that, great prof. :) LOTS of information though. :( The class was a lot, but the prof made it better :)

Great class to take if you're interested in Ancient Egypt as Ernest is a knowledgable and entertaining lecturer. 6 hours a week (intersession) is a lot but he shows movies to help pass the time. Minimal work as there are 3 tests and no assignments. Study the lecture slides and you'll get a good grade. Textbooks provides extra context but not needed
This guy is a legend. Easy class and is super fun. Tests were all from lecture slides and if you can memorize a little bit, you'll for sure get over 90.

Two hr lecture followed by one hr movie. Attending class is a must and staying for the movie is a must (he has test questions from the movies). Prepare to write everything down, including things he says in verbatim as he will test you on material that is not from the slides. Never used books. 1st MT avg 80%. 2nd MT avg 67%. Final avg 75%.
Nice prof
Going to lectures is your best bet for getting a good grade. Ernest goes into extended detail about what's on his slides, so show up for extra information.
Ernest is a genuinely nice guy and is always willing to talk to students. Much respect for him.
Long lectures, but attending them will help prepare you for exams.
Attend class and go through the notes before exams. You will do well.
Great prof, great lectures.
Long lectures, but fairly simple material. Would take again.
Great lectures, great subject. Overall 1010 class.
Funny guy that knows how to keep the students engaged.
Great lectures, but lots of material to memorize.
Great class to learn some history on Egypt.
great guy and fun class
Ernest is a great lecturer and really knows his stuff!
Great lectures, interesting material.
Long lectures, but very fair exams. Memorize the notes, textbook is not needed.
Ernest is always willing to help you out and doesn't shy away from questions. Show up to class, do the work, and you will get a good grade. Highly recommend.
Lectures are long, but if you put in the effort and show up to class you will do well.
Ernest is one of the best profs at SFU. Truly enjoys teaching his subject and knows a lot about it.
Ernest is a funny guy. Lectures are long but he keeps them light with jokes and quips. Definitely would take another course with him.

Ernest has an extensive knowledge of Ancient Egypt and uses this to make the course interesting for students. The way he teaches allows for maximum knowledge transmission and he provides many interesting analogies that help students remember specific details.
Ernest is an OG best prof in SFU by far. Great guy and makes the class interesting.

Occasionally funny, but generally long lectures taken from text and mildly condensed. He reads off the slides and rarely adds anything extra. Easy tests if you study, will need to know names and rough dates, dynasties at least. We had a small class so some class discussion.
